"CIMP 161_Legacy arsenic pollution in Yellowknife Bay sediments" (dataset). 1.0.0. DataStream. https://doi.org/10.25976/gm49-2a19.</gco:CharacterString>

                </gmd:CI_Citation>
            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The main objective of this project was to evaluate the long-term stability of arsenic contamination from gold mining in sediments of Yellowknife Bay (Great Slave Lake) and the potential for long-term change in arsenic diffusion from sediments to overlying water with climate warming. A multi-disciplinary study was conducted involving field measurements, laboratory experiments, and modelling. As part of the field program, water column profiles of inorganic arsenic, temperature and specific conductivity were measured in Yellowknife Bay to examine to examine the vertical distribution of surface water arsenic.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

            </gmd:language>

                        </gmd:EX_GeographicBoundingBox>
                    </gmd:geographicElement>
                    <gmd:temporalElement>
                        <gmd:EX_TemporalExtent>

                                <gml:TimePeriod gml:id="TimePeriod">

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-gm49-2a19
notes: The main objective of this project was to evaluate the long-term stability of arsenic contamination from gold mining in sediments of Yellowknife Bay (Great Slave Lake) and the potential for long-term change in arsenic diffusion from sediments to overlying water with climate warming. A multi-disciplinary study was conducted involving field measurements, laboratory experiments, and modelling. As part of the field program, water column profiles of inorganic arsenic, temperature and specific conductivity were measured in Yellowknife Bay to examine to examine the vertical distribution of surface water arsenic.

notes_translated.en: The main objective of this project was to evaluate the long-term stability of arsenic contamination from gold mining in sediments of Yellowknife Bay (Great Slave Lake) and the potential for long-term change in arsenic diffusion from sediments to overlying water with climate warming. A multi-disciplinary study was conducted involving field measurements, laboratory experiments, and modelling. As part of the field program, water column profiles of inorganic arsenic, temperature and specific conductivity were measured in Yellowknife Bay to examine to examine the vertical distribution of surface water arsenic.
notes_translated.fr: L'objectif principal de ce projet était d'évaluer la stabilité à long terme de la contamination à l'arsenic provenant de l'extraction de l'or dans les sédiments de la baie de Yellowknife (Grand lac des Esclaves) et la possibilité d'un changement à long terme de la diffusion de l'arsenic des sédiments vers l'eau sus-jacente en raison du réchauffement climatique. Une étude multidisciplinaire a été menée impliquant des mesures sur le terrain, des expériences en laboratoire et des modélisations. Dans le cadre du programme de terrain, les profils d'arsenic inorganique, de température et de conductivité spécifique des colonnes d'eau ont été mesurés dans la baie de Yellowknife afin d'examiner la distribution verticale de l'arsenic dans les eaux de surface.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: CIMP 161_Legacy arsenic pollution in Yellowknife Bay sediments

title_translated.fr: CIMP 161_Pollution héritée à l'arsenic dans les sédiments de la baie de Yellowknife
